text: What if someone creates a page from scratch using the drag and drop UI. They add styles and colors using the style tab. A month goes by and they want to "templatize" this layout. Currently, a developer would have to inspect all of the sections, rows, columns, and modules for all of the settings and try and convert that into a coded template. Could there be an option for a developer to convert a content edited page to a coded template? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Convert-content-page-to-coded-template/idi-p/492238#M91912>
HubSpot to have an insert module icon on the wysiwig text editor that allowed you to drop modules into the rich text part.
You can't place modules into a rich text field
<@UGMGP7A72> is there a particular editor you would find this most valuable in?

We tend to get items like this in our designs which are placed in single blog posts between text.

It would be great from a developer and a user perspective to have a feature that allowed you to add modules into the rich text editor.
<@U38EZFVFE> I know, I’m suggesting the feature. This is aimed more towards blog posts. If you checkout my reply in the thread above you’ll see what I mean.

We’re currently thinking about this functionality. There are some things we have to think through  - like how do we provide the UI for this in a way that’s great for developers, but doesn’t intimidate marketers. We hear you and agree this would be useful.
i think the idea is that in the future we might get the dnd editor in the post view…
not that i actually know this of coarse

<@UGMGP7A72> you’re in luck — we are currently working on this! Feel free to upvote <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Drag-amp-Drop-functionality-for-Blog-Posts/idc-p/488580#M91309|this community post>.
